name: DoubleTree by Hilton San Diego - Del Mar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been pleased everytime we stay here...booked all our rooms through Priceline and have gotten rooms for $75-$90 over the past year.
reviews.title: great hotel for the price!

likes.disliked: — food service could be more interesting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is very clean and located in a residential area of Del Mar. Freeway access is great!
reviews.title: Perfect location to roam around San Diego area

likes.liked: — The hotel personnel were very helpful and willing when asked about anything. They all seemed to enjoy their jobs.
likes.disliked: — The "geek" conventioneers who took my morning newspaper which always got replaced when I called promptly.

reviews.text: The rooms are very comfortable and the staff is friendly! We really like being away from the hustle bustle of other hotels further south!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We just spent 4 nights there as part of our family vacation to the San Diego area and we had a great experience at this hotel. Everything was very clean and felt relatively new. Very nice pool and workout facilities. Very convenient to local attractions, including La Jolla, the beach and Torrey Pines. Convenient shopping and restaurants nearby. Great for adults and kids. I highly recommend. (fyi, we paid the std internet rate, somewhere around $140).
reviews.title: Very good experience

reviews.text: Only minor complaint is there is a lot of traffic noise sitting by the pool as it is very near a couple of busy roads.
reviews.title: A-OK Hotel but Nothing Special

likes.disliked: — I could hear freeway noise from my room

reviews.title: Great Vacation
reviews.text: I landed this hotel via Priceline at a bid of $52.00. The hotel web rate was $139.00. The hotel is located near the 5 and 56 freeways so its very convenient to alot of tourist locations like Torrey Pines State Park. Importantly, this hotel is located near a business park. There is a Marriott and Hampton Inn across the street.

I checked in on a Friday afternoon. There was a little bit of a wait but the clerk was friendly upon check-in. Priceline was mentioned when I asked for a room on a high floor that was quiet. Fortunately, I did get a warm cookie. I was given Room 355 which is down a long hallway and with a view of the business park and the 56 freeway. I could hear car noise when sitting near the window. So the clerk was friendly but really did not honor my request.
reviews.title: Doubletree Del Mar... simply the best!

likes.liked: — The staff, room comfort, and price.
likes.disliked: — Location is a bit industrial... but not really much of a factor if you've got a car.

reviews.text: The lobby area is relatively small. They have a gift shop right next to the front desk that sells soda and munchies. It is nothing special. Off of the lobby was a bar, restaurant, and meeting rooms. Down the first floor hallway was the pool area, fitness center, and business center.
reviews.title: Pleasant for business and leisure

likes.disliked: — No good restaurants within walking distance; located in business park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean - slightly upscale hotel. Staff was curtious, free warm welcome chocolate chip cookies,.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was basic - 2 queens, desk, dressor, 27" TV, w payperview movies and wireless game controller. Beds were extremely soft and comfy.
reviews.title: Pretty, Quiet & Peaceful

likes.liked: — Free WiFi ,warm cookie and AAA discount!

reviews.text: Located only 2-3 miles north of 5/805 split and at most 12-13 miles north of Downtown.
reviews.title: All I expected from a business hotel

likes.disliked: — Noise from highway 5, thin connecting door (so i could hear person next door)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this especially on weekends as it is a business hotel and fairly quiet and easy to get rooms.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Doubletree

likes.liked: — Comfortable bed and quiet setting provided for a great nights sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here right at the end of May and had absolutely no problems!
reviews.title: Nice Price, Good location

likes.liked: — Close to downtown, great price, rooms in great shape
likes.disliked: — Common areas were a little run down

reviews.text: Great deal in December. I have never stayed at a Doubletree before, and frankly, I was a bit afraid! (Fairmont and Ritz, yes, but what is a Doubletree?)
reviews.title: Great Experience at Doubletree Del Mar

likes.liked: — Location and comfort w/ ease of use.

reviews.text: It was great. Free Parking. Great cookie w/ check in. Great location. Beds were decent. Not 5 star, but really comfortable. Rooms were clean. Maid service wonderful.
reviews.title: Excellent location and hotel for the business traveller

reviews.text: No, we didn't have the beds turned down in the late afternoon, nor were bathrobes provided, but it was a delightful cheap and cheerful vacation, and I would do it again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Never stay at a Doubletree/Hilton again!
I want to go back right now!
reviews.text: I actually liked the fact you could "do your thing" at the hotel without having to interface w/ alot of employees~

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great stay and I will not hesitate to book there again.
reviews.title: Always enjoying staying here

reviews.text: We were on our way to San Diego from Palm Springs and were planning to go to the San Diego Wild Animal Park the following morning. We stumbled upon this hotel after finding out that all the hotels in La Jolla were booked on a Wed. night. When we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised. Although they did have a nice looking pool area, we didn't have time to use it. We did partake in the 1/2 price drinks during happy hour at the lounge and used their complimentary business center to get caught up on a few things. Also, we ended up going to a Ruth's Chris Steakhouse down the street later that night and the shuttle bus driver gave us a ride there and back, no charge... The hotel looks like it was currently being updated as the hallways had brand new carpeting and wallpaper, it had the new smell. The room itself was very clean and bright. This would seem to be a perfect hotel to stay at if in town for business, very convenient to I-5 and other highways. We would definately stay there again if in the area.
reviews.title: Nice, Clean Hotel

likes.liked: — Bright, Clean Rooms & Free Business Center
likes.disliked: — In A Business Park, Nothing In Walking Distance...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice quiet hotel, nice pool.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a good deal through Hotwire on this hotel. Nice surprise. Very comfortable beds, friendly staff. Chocolate chip cookies are a nice touch. No complaints here.
reviews.title: Nice stay at the Doubletree

likes.disliked: — bar could have been nicer, closes at 10

reviews.title: Great for the price and convenient location
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel on a Thursday and Friday night with a great Priceline rate of $80.00. The front desk was very accommodating and gave us a room with 2 queens instead of the 1 queen with a pullout couch that we should have gotten with our Priceline bid. Our 2nd floor room faced the pool and we never had a problem with noise. I asked for a refrigerator and one was delivered immediately and for no charge.

This is in a good location if you have a car. It is about a 5 min drive to Del Mar Beach and just about a 15 min drive to La Jolla. The parking is free, which was nice. There is only one restaurant within walking distance, the Tio Leo’s Mexican Restaurant. It had very good food and margaritas. My son enjoyed the Jacuzzi and pool area.
reviews.title: Great location/Clean, Quiet, Comfortable. Very nice and friendly staff

likes.liked: — Quiet, comfortable, Heavenly beds. Great Breakfast Buffett. Super friendly and happy staff

reviews.title: Great pool area, fantastic customers service, and loved the "sweet dream" bed
reviews.text: Priceline (name your own price) $65 bucks. Can't beat that deal in San Diego. Stayed at this hotel Sunday and Monday for Labor Day weekend '08. Loved the pool area. It had a large main pool, nice size spa, and a kiddie pool for the children. Customer service was unbeatable!!! Free convenient parking (which is always nice in San Diego). Room service was offered until 11PM and was delivered very quickly. Amazing "Sweet Dream" bed!!! Lots of towels in bathroom. Pretty much a great hotel for the price I paid. I noticed that the hotel was very pet friendly for those of you taking your little doggies. Would stay here again on business.

Just returned from a weekend in San Diego with 2 kdis (1 and 3) and LOVED the hotel. Great pool, especially the 1 foot deep kiddy pool, LOVED the bed, ultra soft and cozy and the staff was really polite and seemed to make accomodating us a priority. Be sure and ask for a welcoming back-pack for the little ones, it includes all sorts of fun toys and a frisbee if you can believe that! (Who gives a kid a frisbee in a HOTEL ROOM!?) They loved it though.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but LOUD JUNIOR SUITE ROOM

likes.liked: — The comfort of the bed and the pools

reviews.text: The one major downsdie to this hotel, and we had a junior suite, was the noise from one room to the other. Luckily our neighbors were also watchign the Olympics, and we all seemed to go to sleep at the same time... but alas he was up at 4 AM and we heard EVERYTHING... his phone call, his TV... it was a nightmare. We complained and asked them to please keep the room empty for our second night, but of course, they didn't. Why they would put a junior suite across from the elevator and with thin walls seems ... well... you pay a little more to get more, but it didn't feel that way.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: All in all though, the bed was PURE HEAVEN, and pool is great, just be sure and ask for a QUIET ROOM and you will be very pleased.
reviews.title: Just off the mark in customer service

reviews.text: A solid 3 star hotel for sure.
reviews.title: Great experience!

description: Five story Hotel, modern decor and popular guest room amenities; located in the north coastal area, two blocks east of I-5.
